title: Legend of the Wanganui River
creator_contributor_role: New Zealand National Film Unit, production company
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/New Zealand - Description and travel
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Maori (New Zealand people) - Social life and customs
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Maori (New Zealand people) - Ethnic identity
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Legends - New Zealand
description: A Maori legend tells of the origin of the Wanganui River long ago. This film recounts the story, revealing something of the importance of the river to Maoris in the past, and illustrating its role today. The camera captures the mood of the river as it cascades down from its mountain source, swirls through narrow gorges, passes by dense forests ringing to the cry of birds, and eventually meets the sea near the city of Wanganui.
